In this conversation, we want to

[**Sean Kross**](https://seankross.com/) is a Data Staff Scientist at the [Fred Hutch Data Science Lab](https://hutchdatascience.org/). His work is focused on understanding [data science as a practice](https://courses.csail.mit.edu/18.337/2015/docs/50YearsDataScience.pdf), building a better [developer experience](https://future.a16z.com/the-case-for-developer-experience/) for data scientists, and creating better outcomes in [digital education](https://youtu.be/GG5Vl7N5vCo). He approaches these challenges with computational, statistical, ethnographic, and design-driven methods.

Previously Sean earned his PhD in Human-Computer Interaction at the University of California San Diego where he was advised by [Philip Guo](https://pg.ucsd.edu/). During his PhD he interned at the [Research in Software Engineering Group](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/group/research-software-engineering-rise/) and the [Computational Social Science Group](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/theme/computational-social-science/) at Microsoft Research. Before he started graduate school Sean was the Chief Technology Officer at the [Johns Hopkins Data Science Lab](https://jhudatascience.org/). He is also a frequent consultant for data analysis and software development projects, in addition to being a maintainer of several open source software projects.
